channel.title: RS2 Private Server Structure (HybridScape)
channel.description:
Those of you who are not familiar with rs2 private server sources let me fill you in a little bit (if you are familiar skip this paragraph), the structure is abysmal, the worst part being a single switch statement controlling EVERYTHING, with large amounts of if statements inside of each switch entry, it is horrible, also the whole playerarray is looped through every few milliseconds and updated that way, basically it needs entirely restructured.
Problem is, while I can usually code whatever is put to me, I am no good at code design, so I would like it if anyone at all could point me in the right direction for a general structure for a private server, a few of us were discussing this in the IRC the other day so I have vague ideas, but nothing really concrete, so please discuss :)
1. One of my ideas I think would be a good thing is to write a few custom listeners perhaps for things like items, npcs, objects, and players, so that they could all be handled that way.
2. regex mentioned I should probably make the item, npc, object, and player class all extend one base class, so that they could all be controlled through that I am assuming?
3. To eliminate the need to loop through the entire player array every cycle, would it be a good idea to put them into a hashmap and just check if they need anything?
please add and discuss, The hybridscape dev team really needs help on this, we are also looking for anyone willing to help, we are on sourceforge, just tell me if you would like to help out ;D http://sourceforge.net/projects/hybridscape

item.title: RS2 Private Server Structure (HybridScape)
item.dc:creator: @wL1 wL
item.description:
@wL1 wrote:

moparisthebest:

1. One of my ideas I think would be a good thing is to write a few custom listeners perhaps for things like items, npcs, objects, and players, so that they could all be handled that way.

I was thinking about a way of scripting all this long ago, and recently again for the rsc server. The solution we find can is useful for rs2 aswell. See the rscd wiki for some brain storming on that.

moparisthebest:

3. To eliminate the need to loop through the entire player array every cycle, would it be a good idea to put them into a hashmap and just check if they need anything?

The entire player array has to be looped through anyway each cycle, since, even if the player is just standing, an idle packet is sent to the client. The for example in PlayerUpdate.updateThisPlayerMovement

[CODE] if(plr.dir1 == -1) {
// don’t have to update the character position, because we’re just standing
if(hasUpdateBlock) {
// tell client there’s an update block appended at the end
str.writeBits(1, 1);
str.writeBits(2, 0);
}
else str.writeBits(1, 0);
}

[/CODE]
This is required in order to keep server and client synchronized. Even worse, if no packet arrives for some time the client thinks it lost connection to the server and reconnects.

Read full topic

item.title: RS2 Private Server Structure (HybridScape)
item.dc:creator: @wL1 wL
item.description:
@wL1 wrote:

[quote=“moparisthebest, post:10, topic:5518”][quote author=frank_ link=topic=7306.msg75262#msg75262 date=1153403796]
I noticed in eXemplar’s source he had an event dispatcher sort of business, I am not entirely sure how it works, though someone smarter will know.

Perhaps if you were to break the map up into chunks on approximately 64x64 you could hav player-lists for each map section and only those relevant map chunks’ lists would be processed.
[/quote]

Thats what I was thinking, writing event listeners would make it better, but it needs more than just that too

I believe that someone has done the map region thing in an rs2 server, silabsoft mentioned somthing about it to me, I think she said that phate and whitefang had done it and it makes everything alot smoother, but I have never really paid much attention to private server events before this last week or so and I wouldnt know where/how to get the source or info on it.[/quote]

[quote=“Swift, post:11, topic:5518”]Yeah, Winterlove has done a worldmaphandler, and he also listed out all the objects in RS2 into xml files.
Winterlove just gave it to Phate, and Phate liked me enough to pass it onto me

I might be able to share it with only one of you guys, since I promised I won’t give it out =[/quote]
I posted that code a few times, however it doesn’t seem to be widely spread.
my server code (very old!)

The map dumper is completely C++ since it’s built in my renderer but I’m not going to release it this time.
If you think a map dump is useful for you grab it here.

Read full topic

item.title: RS2 Private Server Structure (HybridScape)
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Sean:

There are alot of similarities but it may prove optimal to change the design for rs2 vs rsc. When I post the final design of the rsc server you can look over it and feel free to borrow ideas.

Ok, thank you, I appreciate it, I can’t wait to start coding

item.title: RS2 Private Server Structure (HybridScape)
item.dc:creator: @silabsoft RuneAgent
item.description:
@silabsoft wrote:

i have a general idea where to get the map dump when i was working with whitefang to get them i stumbled on it give me a few minutes and ill post it[br][size=1]Posted at: July 20, 2006, 07:32:54 PM[/size][hr]all the world map stuff is in class 11

[code]
public void method210()
{
for(int i = 0; i < anInt292; i++)
{
for(int j = 0; j < anInt293; j++)
if(i == 0 || j == 0 || i == anInt292 - 1 || j == anInt293 - 1)
anIntArrayArray294[i][j] = 0xffffff;

            else 
                anIntArrayArray294[i][j] = 0x1000000;
		
		////recordit("method210", Integer.toString(i));//record it 1
		
    }

}

public void method211(int i, int j, int k, int l, byte byte0, boolean flag)
{

////recordit(“method211”, Integer.toString(i)+" “+Integer.toString(j)+” “+Integer.toString(k)+” “+Integer.toString(l)+” “+Byte.toString(byte0)+” "+Boolean.toString(flag));////recordit2
k -= anInt290;
i -= anInt291;
if(byte0 == 1)
byte0 = 0;
else
return;
if(l == 0)
{
if(j == 0)
{
method214(k, i, 128);
method214(k - 1, i, 8);
}
if(j == 1)
{
method214(k, i, 2);
method214(k, i + 1, 32);
}
if(j == 2)
{
method214(k, i, 8);
method214(k + 1, i, 128);
}
if(j == 3)
{
method214(k, i, 32);
method214(k, i - 1, 2);
}
}
if(l == 1 || l == 3)
{
if(j == 0)
{
method214(k, i, 1);
method214(k - 1, i + 1, 16);
}
if(j == 1)
{
method214(k, i, 4);
method214(k + 1, i + 1, 64);
}
if(j == 2)
{
method214(k, i, 16);
method214(k + 1, i - 1, 1);
}
if(j == 3)
{
method214(k, i, 64);
method214(k - 1, i - 1, 4);
}
}
if(l == 2)
{
if(j == 0)
{
method214(k, i, 130);
method214(k - 1, i, 8);
method214(k, i + 1, 32);
}
if(j == 1)
{
method214(k, i, 10);
method214(k, i + 1, 32);
method214(k + 1, i, 128);
}
if(j == 2)
{
method214(k, i, 40);
method214(k + 1, i, 128);
method214(k, i - 1, 2);
}
if(j == 3)
{
method214(k, i, 160);
method214(k, i - 1, 2);
method214(k - 1, i, 8);
}
}
if(flag)
{
if(l == 0)
{
if(j == 0)
{
method214(k, i, 0x10000);
method214(k - 1, i, 4096);
}
if(j == 1)
{
method214(k, i, 1024);
method214(k, i + 1, 16384);
}
if(j == 2)
{
method214(k, i, 4096);
method214(k + 1, i, 0x10000);
}
if(j == 3)
{
method214(k, i, 16384);
method214(k, i - 1, 1024);
}
}
if(l == 1 || l == 3)
{
if(j == 0)
{
method214(k, i, 512);
method214(k - 1, i + 1, 8192);
}
if(j == 1)
{
method214(k, i, 2048);
method214(k + 1, i + 1, 32768);
}
if(j == 2)
{
method214(k, i, 8192);
method214(k + 1, i - 1, 512);
}
if(j == 3)
{
method214(k, i, 32768);
method214(k - 1, i - 1, 2048);
}
}
if(l == 2)
{
if(j == 0)
{
method214(k, i, 0x10400);
method214(k - 1, i, 4096);
method214(k, i + 1, 16384);
}
if(j == 1)
{
method214(k, i, 5120);
method214(k, i + 1, 16384);
method214(k + 1, i, 0x10000);
}
if(j == 2)
{
method214(k, i, 20480);
method214(k + 1, i, 0x10000);
method214(k, i - 1, 1024);
}
if(j == 3)
{
method214(k, i, 0x14000);
method214(k, i - 1, 1024);
method214(k - 1, i, 4096);
}
}
}
}

public void method212(boolean flag, int i, int j, int k, int l, int i1, int j1)
{

////recordit(“method212”, Boolean.toString(flag)+" “+Integer.toString(i)+” “+Integer.toString(j)+” “+Integer.toString(k)+” “+Integer.toString(l)+” “+Integer.toString(i1)+” "+Integer.toString(j1));////recordit3
int k1 = 256;
if(flag)
k1 += 0x20000;
l -= anInt290;
i = 14 / i;
i1 -= anInt291;
if(j1 == 1 || j1 == 3)
{
int l1 = j;
j = k;
k = l1;
}
for(int i2 = l; i2 < l + j; i2++)
if(i2 >= 0 && i2 < anInt292)
{
for(int j2 = i1; j2 < i1 + k; j2++)
if(j2 >= 0 && j2 < anInt293)
method214(i2, j2, k1);

        }

}

public void method213(int i, int j, int k)
{

//recordit(“method213”,Integer.toString(i)+" “+Integer.toString(j)+” “+Integer.toString(k));////recordit4
k -= anInt290;
if(j != 0)
aBoolean282 = !aBoolean282;
i -= anInt291;
anIntArrayArray294[k][i] |= 0x200000;
//recordit(“method213b”,Integer.toString(i)+” “+Integer.toString(j)+” "+Integer.toString(k));////recordit4b
}

private void method214(int i, int j, int k)
{
    anIntArrayArray294[i][j] |= k;

//recordit(“method214”,Integer.toString(i)+" “+Integer.toString(j)+” "+Integer.toString(k));////recordit5
}

public void method215(int i, int j, boolean flag, boolean flag1, int k, int l)
{

//recordit(“method215”,Integer.toString(i)+" “+Integer.toString(j)+” “+Boolean.toString(flag)+” “+Boolean.toString(flag1)+” “+Integer.toString(k)+” "+Integer.toString(l));////recordit6
k -= anInt290;
l -= anInt291;
if(!flag1)
return;
if(j == 0)
{
if(i == 0)
{
method217(128, k, l, 933);
method217(8, k - 1, l, 933);
}
if(i == 1)
{
method217(2, k, l, 933);
method217(32, k, l + 1, 933);
}
if(i == 2)
{
method217(8, k, l, 933);
method217(128, k + 1, l, 933);
}
if(i == 3)
{
method217(32, k, l, 933);
method217(2, k, l - 1, 933);
}
}
if(j == 1 || j == 3)
{
if(i == 0)
{
method217(1, k, l, 933);
method217(16, k - 1, l + 1, 933);
}
if(i == 1)
{
method217(4, k, l, 933);
method217(64, k + 1, l + 1, 933);
}
if(i == 2)
{
method217(16, k, l, 933);
method217(1, k + 1, l - 1, 933);
}
if(i == 3)
{
method217(64, k, l, 933);
method217(4, k - 1, l - 1, 933);
}
}
if(j == 2)
{
if(i == 0)
{
method217(130, k, l, 933);
method217(8, k - 1, l, 933);
method217(32, k, l + 1, 933);
}
if(i == 1)
{
method217(10, k, l, 933);
method217(32, k, l + 1, 933);
method217(128, k + 1, l, 933);
}
if(i == 2)
{
method217(40, k, l, 933);
method217(128, k + 1, l, 933);
method217(2, k, l - 1, 933);
}
if(i == 3)
{
method217(160, k, l, 933);
method217(2, k, l - 1, 933);
method217(8, k - 1, l, 933);
}
}
if(flag)
{
if(j == 0)
{
if(i == 0)
{
method217(0x10000, k, l, 933);
method217(4096, k - 1, l, 933);
}
if(i == 1)
{
method217(1024, k, l, 933);
method217(16384, k, l + 1, 933);
}
if(i == 2)
{
method217(4096, k, l, 933);
method217(0x10000, k + 1, l, 933);
}
if(i == 3)
{
method217(16384, k, l, 933);
method217(1024, k, l - 1, 933);
}
}
if(j == 1 || j == 3)
{
if(i == 0)
{
method217(512, k, l, 933);
method217(8192, k - 1, l + 1, 933);
}
if(i == 1)
{
method217(2048, k, l, 933);
method217(32768, k + 1, l + 1, 933);
}
if(i == 2)
{
method217(8192, k, l, 933);
method217(512, k + 1, l - 1, 933);
}
if(i == 3)
{
method217(32768, k, l, 933);
method217(2048, k - 1, l - 1, 933);
}
}
if(j == 2)
{
if(i == 0)
{
method217(0x10400, k, l, 933);
method217(4096, k - 1, l, 933);
method217(16384, k, l + 1, 933);
}
if(i == 1)
{
method217(5120, k, l, 933);
method217(16384, k, l + 1, 933);
method217(0x10000, k + 1, l, 933);
}
if(i == 2)
{
method217(20480, k, l, 933);
method217(0x10000, k + 1, l, 933);
method217(1024, k, l - 1, 933);
}
if(i == 3)
{
method217(0x14000, k, l, 933);
method217(1024, k, l - 1, 933);
method217(4096, k - 1, l, 933);
}
}
}
}

public void method216(int i, int j, int k, int l, byte byte0, int i1, boolean flag)

{

//recordit(“method216”, Integer.toString(i)+" “+Integer.toString(j)+” “+Integer.toString(l)+” “+Integer.toString(i1)+” "+Boolean.toString(flag));////recordit7
int j1 = 256;
if(flag)
j1 += 0x20000;
k -= anInt290;
l -= anInt291;
if(byte0 != 6)
aBoolean282 = !aBoolean282;
if(i == 1 || i == 3)
{
int k1 = j;
j = i1;
i1 = k1;
}
for(int l1 = k; l1 < k + j; l1++)
if(l1 >= 0 && l1 < anInt292)
{
for(int i2 = l; i2 < l + i1; i2++)
if(i2 >= 0 && i2 < anInt293)
method217(j1, l1, i2, 933);

        }

}

private void method217(int i, int j, int k, int l)
{
    l = 36 / l;
    anIntArrayArray294[j][k] &= 0xffffff - i;

//recordit(“method217”, Integer.toString(i)+" “+Integer.toString(j)+” “+Integer.toString(k)+” "+Integer.toString(l));////recordit8
}

public void method218(int i, int j, int k)
{

//recordit(“method218”, Integer.toString(i)+" “+Integer.toString(j)+” “+Integer.toString(k));////recordit9
k -= anInt290;
j -= anInt291;
i = 6 / i;
anIntArrayArray294[k][j] &= 0xdfffff;
//recordit(“method218b”, Integer.toString(i)+” “+Integer.toString(j)+” "+Integer.toString(k));////recordit10
}

public boolean method219(int i, int j, int k, int l, int i1, int j1, int k1)
{

//recordit(“method219”, Integer.toString(i)+" “+Integer.toString(j)+” “+Integer.toString(k)+” “+Integer.toString(l)+” “+Integer.toString(i1)+” “+Integer.toString(j1)+” "+Integer.toString(k1));////recordit11
if(l != 0)
aBoolean282 = !aBoolean282;
if(j == i && k == k1)
return true;
j -= anInt290;
k -= anInt291;
i -= anInt290;
k1 -= anInt291;
if(j1 == 0)
if(i1 == 0)
{
if(j == i - 1 && k == k1)
return true;
if(j == i && k == k1 + 1 && (anIntArrayArray294[j][k] & 0x1280120) == 0)
return true;
if(j == i && k == k1 - 1 && (anIntArrayArray294[j][k] & 0x1280102) == 0)
return true;
} else
if(i1 == 1)
{
if(j == i && k == k1 + 1)
return true;
if(j == i - 1 && k == k1 && (anIntArrayArray294[j][k] & 0x1280108) == 0)
return true;
if(j == i + 1 && k == k1 && (anIntArrayArray294[j][k] & 0x1280180) == 0)
return true;
} else
if(i1 == 2)
{
if(j == i + 1 && k == k1)
return true;
if(j == i && k == k1 + 1 && (anIntArrayArray294[j][k] & 0x1280120) == 0)
return true;
if(j == i && k == k1 - 1 && (anIntArrayArray294[j][k] & 0x1280102) == 0)
return true;
} else
if(i1 == 3)
{
if(j == i && k == k1 - 1)
return true;
if(j == i - 1 && k == k1 && (anIntArrayArray294[j][k] & 0x1280108) == 0)
return true;
if(j == i + 1 && k == k1 && (anIntArrayArray294[j][k] & 0x1280180) == 0)
return true;
}
if(j1 == 2)
if(i1 == 0)
{
if(j == i - 1 && k == k1)
return true;
if(j == i && k == k1 + 1)
return true;
if(j == i + 1 && k == k1 && (anIntArrayArray294[j][k] & 0x1280180) == 0)
return true;
if(j == i && k == k1 - 1 && (anIntArrayArray294[j][k] & 0x1280102) == 0)
return true;
} else
if(i1 == 1)
{
if(j == i - 1 && k == k1 && (anIntArrayArray294[j][k] & 0x1280108) == 0)
return true;
if(j == i && k == k1 + 1)
return true;
if(j == i + 1 && k == k1)
return true;
if(j == i && k == k1 - 1 && (anIntArrayArray294[j][k] & 0x1280102) == 0)
return true;
} else
if(i1 == 2)
{
if(j == i - 1 && k == k1 && (anIntArrayArray294[j][k] & 0x1280108) == 0)
return true;
if(j == i && k == k1 + 1 && (anIntArrayArray294[j][k] & 0x1280120) == 0)
return true;
if(j == i + 1 && k == k1)
return true;
if(j == i && k == k1 - 1)
return true;
} else
if(i1 == 3)
{
if(j == i - 1 && k == k1)
return true;
if(j == i && k == k1 + 1 && (anIntArrayArray294[j][k] & 0x1280120) == 0)
return true;
if(j == i + 1 && k == k1 && (anIntArrayArray294[j][k] & 0x1280180) == 0)
return true;
if(j == i && k == k1 - 1)
return true;
}
if(j1 == 9)
{
if(j == i && k == k1 + 1 && (anIntArrayArray294[j][k] & 0x20) == 0)
return true;
if(j == i && k == k1 - 1 && (anIntArrayArray294[j][k] & 2) == 0)
return true;
if(j == i - 1 && k == k1 && (anIntArrayArray294[j][k] & 8) == 0)
return true;
if(j == i + 1 && k == k1 && (anIntArrayArray294[j][k] & 0x80) == 0)
return true;
}
return false;
}

[/code][br][size=1]Posted at: July 20, 2006, 07:44:59 PM[/size][hr][code]
public boolean method220(int i, int j, int k, int l, int i1, int j1, int k1)
{
//recordit(“method220”, Integer.toString(i)+" “+Integer.toString(j)+” “+Integer.toString(k)+” “+Integer.toString(l)+” “+Integer.toString(i1)+” “+Integer.toString(j1)+” “+Integer.toString(k1));////recordit12
if(k1 != 0)
throw new NullPointerException();
if(j1 == i && k == j)
return true;
j1 -= anInt290;
k -= anInt291;
i -= anInt290;
j -= anInt291;
//recordit(“method220b”, Integer.toString(i)+” “+Integer.toString(j)+” “+Integer.toString(k)+” “+Integer.toString(l)+” “+Integer.toString(i1)+” “+Integer.toString(j1)+” "+Integer.toString(k1));////recordit13
if(l == 6 || l == 7)
{
if(l == 7)
i1 = i1 + 2 & 3;
if(i1 == 0)
{
if(j1 == i + 1 && k == j && (anIntArrayArray294[j1][k] & 0x80) == 0)
return true;
if(j1 == i && k == j - 1 && (anIntArrayArray294[j1][k] & 2) == 0)
return true;
} else
if(i1 == 1)
{
if(j1 == i - 1 && k == j && (anIntArrayArray294[j1][k] & 8) == 0)
return true;
if(j1 == i && k == j - 1 && (anIntArrayArray294[j1][k] & 2) == 0)
return true;
} else
if(i1 == 2)
{
if(j1 == i - 1 && k == j && (anIntArrayArray294[j1][k] & 8) == 0)
return true;
if(j1 == i && k == j + 1 && (anIntArrayArray294[j1][k] & 0x20) == 0)
return true;
} else
if(i1 == 3)
{
if(j1 == i + 1 && k == j && (anIntArrayArray294[j1][k] & 0x80) == 0)
return true;
if(j1 == i && k == j + 1 && (anIntArrayArray294[j1][k] & 0x20) == 0)
return true;
}
}
if(l == 8)
{
if(j1 == i && k == j + 1 && (anIntArrayArray294[j1][k] & 0x20) == 0)
return true;
if(j1 == i && k == j - 1 && (anIntArrayArray294[j1][k] & 2) == 0)
return true;
if(j1 == i - 1 && k == j && (anIntArrayArray294[j1][k] & 8) == 0)
return true;
if(j1 == i + 1 && k == j && (anIntArrayArray294[j1][k] & 0x80) == 0)
return true;
}
return false;
}

public boolean method221(byte byte0, int i, int j, int k, int l, int i1, int j1, 
        int k1)

{

//recordit(“method221”, Integer.toString(i)+" “+Integer.toString(j)+” “+Integer.toString(k)+” “+Integer.toString(l)+” “+Integer.toString(i1)+” "+Integer.toString(j1));////recordit14
if(byte0 != 1)
throw new NullPointerException();
int l1 = (j + j1) - 1;
int i2 = (i + l) - 1;
if(k >= j && k <= l1 && k1 >= i && k1 <= i2)
return true;
if(k == j - 1 && k1 >= i && k1 <= i2 && (anIntArrayArray294[k - anInt290][k1 - anInt291] & 8) == 0 && (i1 & 8) == 0)
return true;
if(k == l1 + 1 && k1 >= i && k1 <= i2 && (anIntArrayArray294[k - anInt290][k1 - anInt291] & 0x80) == 0 && (i1 & 2) == 0)
return true;
if(k1 == i - 1 && k >= j && k <= l1 && (anIntArrayArray294[k - anInt290][k1 - anInt291] & 2) == 0 && (i1 & 4) == 0)
return true;
return k1 == i2 + 1 && k >= j && k <= l1 && (anIntArrayArray294[k - anInt290][k1 - anInt291] & 0x20) == 0 && (i1 & 1) == 0;
}
[/code][br][size=1]Posted at: July 20, 2006, 07:45:14 PM[/size][hr]i cant remember but im pretty sure its method 214 u record for it to record all the data ill run it later to confirm but here is the entire world map! http://hybridscape.no-ip.org/world.cfg

item.title: RS2 Private Server Structure (HybridScape)
item.dc:creator: @frank frank_
item.description:
@frank wrote:

[quote=“moparisthebest, post:8, topic:5518”]The basic design/structure of an rs2 server would be the same as an rsc server wouldnt it? Obviously all of the packets and most of the little details are different, but the big picture should be practically identical?[/quote]I dont know whether its just me or what, but as I based my RSC on winterloves release it is similar in places and totally different in others. When I recently recoded it, I also modified how the update requirements are stored so that it decreases the number of loops needed (though I am yet to kill the bugs).

I noticed in eXemplar’s source he had an event dispatcher sort of business, I am not entirely sure how it works, though someone smarter will know.

Perhaps if you were to break the map up into chunks on approximately 64x64 you could hav player-lists for each map section and only those relevant map chunks’ lists would be processed.

item.title: RS2 Private Server Structure (HybridScape)
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Those of you who are not familiar with rs2 private server sources let me fill you in a little bit (if you are familiar skip this paragraph), the structure is abysmal, the worst part being a single switch statement controlling EVERYTHING, with large amounts of if statements inside of each switch entry, it is horrible, also the whole playerarray is looped through every few milliseconds and updated that way, basically it needs entirely restructured.

Problem is, while I can usually code whatever is put to me, I am no good at code design, so I would like it if anyone at all could point me in the right direction for a general structure for a private server, a few of us were discussing this in the IRC the other day so I have vague ideas, but nothing really concrete, so please discuss

  1. One of my ideas I think would be a good thing is to write a few custom listeners perhaps for things like items, npcs, objects, and players, so that they could all be handled that way.

  2. regex mentioned I should probably make the item, npc, object, and player class all extend one base class, so that they could all be controlled through that I am assuming?

  3. To eliminate the need to loop through the entire player array every cycle, would it be a good idea to put them into a hashmap and just check if they need anything?

please add and discuss, The hybridscape dev team really needs help on this, we are also looking for anyone willing to help, we are on sourceforge, just tell me if you would like to help out ;D http://sourceforge.net/projects/hybridscape

Read full topic
